name: Nasama Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looked after from the time we arrived. Checked in effortlessly and then helped with bags to our room. Room was very clean and spacious for the two of us. Great view we could see both the pool and the ocean. The pool at night is amazing with the blue lights. Daily the room was cleaned and there was everything you needed including washing machine and dryer right outside your rooms. Very close to breakas for meals and snorkling. also lagoon is only a few km down the road where you catch the boat over to erakor island to eat or swim and snorkle over the reef. btw the cost to go over is 2000v but comes off the price of food or drinks.Elizabeth and the other ladies behind the reception counter were lovely and helpful. Both Daniel the security guard and Chanel were also very nice. Make sure you ask Daniel to try their jamblang fruit fresh off the tree. Overall an amazing first time experience in vanuatu and wonderful place to stay. Very highly regarded when you said where you were staying. Thank you Nasama staff and see you again soon.
reviews.title: Perfect for a holiday

Amazing and the best Nasama Resort
reviews.text: Just got back from the best holiday at Nasama Resort. The staff are fantastic, the rooms were wonderful - we had 3 apartments in total between 7 of us and we felt truly spoilt. Would recommend Nasama to everyone be it a romantic or a family holiday it works for all.. And did I mention the wonderful staff. Close to Port Vila, simply hop on the local bus's for around $1.50 a trip, it's a wonderful part of travelling in Vanuatu where you can meet the friendliest, and happiest bunch of locals around. Make sure you get to the Beach Bar on Friday evenings to see jaw dropping fire dancers along with dancing on the beach to the local DJ.. That really capped off our special holiday in Vanuatu. If u need your coffee fix head for the French Patisserie opposite the fresh produce market - their coffee is some of the best I have had anywhere around the world. Nasama gets 10 stars if we could go that high. Can't wait to visit again.

reviews.text: We looked at other resorts in and around Port Vila when we were there and found Nasama Resort is real and genuine value for money. Stay for at least 7 days, and the value gets so good that it's a surprise the place is not booked out long in advance.
reviews.title: Great value, fantastic staff

reviews.text: It is a great value place to stay on Efate if you like spacious clean rooms and being self- sufficient. The service is excellent, staff friendly and helpful (say hi to Chanel and Daniel), and while the location is about 4kms out of Port Vila town centre, the main town centre and other destinations are easily accessible by bus which are regular, convenient, and cheap.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Nasama experience is about self- sufficiency as it has neither a restaurant nor a bar. It does have a small range of items in the reception. However, it is best to do your shopping at one of the Bon Marche supermarkets and the fresh market at the seawall in town.
reviews.title: exceptional view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But why have a bar when you can get good priced beer or wine in town, put it in your fridge, and sit on your balcony relaxing at the end of the day? Going back to Nasama was a great end to a day of barging around the island, being on a tour, or having spent the day out snorkelling or diving. It doesn’t take long to whip up a dish of chilli and lime prawns with some local greens in a salad accompanied by a few cold Tusker beers.
reviews.title: Great Getaway

reviews.text: And for breakfast? What better than some fruit salad with fresh fruit bought from the markets and toast to start the day, all from your own kitchenette. The other guests we met at the resort were doing this and having a ball.
reviews.title: Best place to stay

reviews.text: My partner and I with our 9 month old daughter have just a truly relaxing stay at this quiet resort. It is exactly the holiday we wanted,do as much or as little as you want. We stayed in a studio apartment, which are well kitted out and are spacious. The swimming pool is gorgeous and most times have it to yourself. The grounds are well cared for, and the cleaning team - Ruth and Lita are fab. The reception team of Ashley and Elizabeth do a good job. You are close to supermarkets and the fruit market at Port Vila to cater for yourself, cook in the kitchen or use the bbq facilities,there are also a variety of restaurants all local for dining out. The islanders are wonderful people and all are happy and friendly, always smiley and courteous. We hired a car for a week from world car rentals- see Stalin or Shelley, again so lovely to deal with. All in, a great island to holiday on, a great resort to stay at, definitely go again. See you soon. Many thanks :))
reviews.title: Thanks for a relaxing holiday

reviews.text: We stayed at Nasama recently and had a wonderful break thanks to the location, accomodation and staff. 10 minutes out of Port Vila by local bus and a short walk or bus ride to other resorts is far enough away to provide added peace and quiet, but close enough to allow a wide range of options for activities and dining. The cooking facilities in the rooms (cooktop, microwave, toaster and kettle) and in the resort (BBQ) allow for good self catering if you wish, with supermarkets and local shops close by and a limited range of essentials at the reception shop. The starter pack of cooking oil, salt and pepper is a good idea and saves buying these when you only need small amounts. Alternatively, there are lots of restaurants in resorts close by if you want to avoid a ride into Vila. Nasama is on the smaller side and has large grounds with a number of different places to hang out; pool, kids pool, BBQ area, beach, or your balcony or patio all of which have great outlooks to the ocean which is just a few steps away from your room. The local busses are fantastic - wave your hand and they will pick you up and drop you wherever you like for a small fixed amount per person; sometimes with the added bonus of island music, interior disco lights, or conversation about good places to eat or things to see.
reviews.title: Great resort and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Nasama staff are very helpful - particularly Elizabeth who recommended specific tour operators (not the big ones) for a more authentic island tour, and arranged airport transfers for us. Chanel also made sure we were pleasantly introduced to the room and facilities and made sure we had everything we needed. Being a new resort there was still a bit of work being done on the grounds but this is mainly tidying up and adding landscaping so shouldn't inconvenience anyone. Vanuatu itself is so handy to Sydney (except for the stupid flight times) that we will certainly return and when we do, I am sure we will be staying at Nasama.
reviews.title: Peace, comfort, and being surrounded by the real Vanuatu

reviews.text: Nasama’s distance from the centre of Vila should be no deterrent: local buses drive along Pango Road regularly and frequently. Being four kilometres from the traffic chaos and tourist-shops probably contributes to its peace, comforts and the feeling that you are surrounded by the real Vanuatu.
reviews.title: Nasama Resort - a top place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort’s rooms are spacious, comfortable, tastefully decorated and appointed, and clean. We were provided with milk, biscuits, tea and Tanna coffee, … and further provisions can be found in the Reception/Store.
reviews.title: Affordable and good quality

description: Located just 10 minutes from the centre of Port Vila, Vanuatu and 20 mins from the airport is Nasama Resort opening in March 2012. Each plantation style apartment is spacious and self-contained with a full kitchen, wireless internet, air-conditioning, satellite and TV/DVD. Every apartment features magnificent views from private balconies/patios of the ocean and the large curving adults' and childrens' pools. Perfect for the family with BBQs and just a quick trip to stock up from the local supermarket, Nasama has all the space and amenities of a home away from home. Just a short stroll down the road to one of the best surfing spots in Vanuatu.
